description: Dive into "Capturing Mae Rim's Scenic Wonders" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Mae Rim's Scenic Wonders

places.generalDescription: Wat Pa Dara Phirom Phra Aram Luang is a stunning Buddhist temple complex located in Mae Rim, near Chiang Mai. This 100-year-old royal temple boasts intricate Yanna-inspired architecture and houses a remarkable collection of artifacts, gemstones, and jewels. The ornate buildings and lush tropical surroundings make it one of the most significant temples in the area.

sources.snippet: Wat Pa Dara Phirom Temple is a Buddhist temple in Mae Rim, close to Chiang Mai. This 100-year-old temple has a collection of artifacts, gemstones, and jewels. This temple has Yanna-inspired architecture and is created with intricate craftsmanship.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

sources.snippet: Wat Pa Dara Pirom: It is one of the beautiful temples of Mae Rim District and one of the most beautiful temples in Chiang Mai. The buildings are exquisite in Lanna style architecture, Wat Phadarabhiro...
sources.shortName: Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

places.name: Wat Pa Dara Phirom Phra Aram Luang

reviews.text: I have been here twice, to pay homage to the sacred relics at the Glass Hall and to pay homage to the sacred Buddha. There is a beautiful church and when you enter here you can feel the faith of the people.

If you have the chance to visit Mae Rim, make sure to stop by this temple to pay respects to the sacred Buddha's tooth relic. The climb up the stairs to the upper hall is well worth it-the chamber is exquisitely ornate, housing a collection of stunning ancient artifacts that feel like a mini-museum. The wall murals truly are exquisite , and the rest of the temple is equally impressive, exuding Lanna artistry in every detail. The atmosphere is serene and lush, making it a peaceful retreat.

‚ÄúAn Oasis of Peace and Spiritual Beauty‚Äù

Wat Pa Dara Phirom Monastery is an absolute gem that beautifully blends serene spirituality with stunning architecture. Nestled in the lush greenery of Mae Rim, this temple offers an atmosphere of profound tranquility.

The intricate details of the temple buildings are breathtaking, showcasing Northern Thai Lanna art at its finest. The golden pagodas, colorful murals, and ornate carvings reflect a deep sense of history and craftsmanship.

What makes this monastery even more special is its calm and peaceful environment, away from the usual tourist crowds. It's the perfect place for reflection, meditation, or simply enjoying the serene surroundings.

The monks and caretakers are welcoming and kind, adding to the sense of warmth and sacredness. Every corner of this place exudes positive energy, making it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking peace or cultural enrichment.

If you're in the Chiang Mai area, don't miss Wat Pa Dara Phirom. It's more than just a temple-it's an unforgettable spiritual experience. 5 stars all the way!

places.address: WW6R+7GJ, Rim Tai, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled just outside the bustling gates of Chiang Mai's old city, Wat Lok Moli is a captivating Buddhist temple that dates back to at least the 1300s. Unlike most temples that face east, this unique site aligns along a north-south axis, adding to its charm. The highlight here is its striking chedi, one of the tallest in the area, which houses the ashes of several kings from the Mengrai dynasty.

sources.snippet: Another stunning Lanna temple in Chiang Mai is Wat Lok Moli. Both Viharn and the nearby big chedi are popular locations for photographers visiting Chiang Mai.It is right next to Wat Rajamontean, and like Wat Rajamontean, it is not too crowded. These two sights are easily complementary to one another.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Instagrammable Places In Chiang Mai

places.name: Wat Lok Moli

reviews.text:
Quiet and peaceful temple.
The architecture is beautiful and it feels like a trip to ancient times.
Feels sacred and serene.
You can just sit inside the temple for a while to calm the mind down.
We visited this temple which was near our hotel. There is an old stupa at the back of the shrine hall. It is lit up at night and looks nice. The shrine hall was peaceful and quiet.

This was Absolutely Beautiful and loved the art and architecture of everything. The size and mass of some things are so impressive. Such a great stop on the temple quest and must be added to your go to list for temples.

Feels very spiritual and i highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Doi Suthep-Pui National Park is a forested sanctuary in Chiang Mai Province, Thailand, known for its natural beauty and cultural landmarks. The park encompasses two mountains, Doi Suthep and Doi Pui, and is home to the revered Wat Phra That Doi Suthep temple. Visitors can climb 309 steps to reach the temple complex and enjoy panoramic views of Chiang Mai.

sources.snippet: You can find this peak right in the middle of Doi Suthep-Pui National Park. It is one of the most popular trekking destinations in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders

places.name: Doi Suthep-Pui National Park

reviews.text:
The Yi Peng Lantern Festival originated from the Lanna culture in Northern Thailand. The meaning of this festival is for people to express their respect to the gods and pray for good luck and prosperity in life.
The Lantern Festival originated from the Lanna belief that if you worship the Buddha's relics during the full moon of the 12th lunar month, you will receive blessings. However, the Buddha's relics are said to be kept in the highest level of heaven, so the Lanna people lit lanterns and released them into the sky to send their wishes.
Beautiful golden temple on the top of the mountain in Chiang Mai . It's easy to go there. You can grab the red local bus or rent the scooter on your own. Try to go in the morning to avoid the crowds.
Absolutely beautiful, well worth the drive, for me it was worth it to rent my own car so I could stop and go to as many places as I wanted.

places.address: RW48+RC4, Sriwichai Alley, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Mon Jam is a mountaintop farming community located near Chiang Mai, offering stunning panoramic views and a tranquil retreat. Visitors can explore the community garden and strawberry farms for a nominal entrance fee, enjoying vibrant gardens, lookout points with swings, and photo props. The area also features charming street vendors selling various goods. Additionally, Mon Jam is easily accessible from nearby attractions such as Pongyang Jungle Coaster and Mori Natural Farm, making it a convenient destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and relaxation.

sources.snippet: Mon Jam is the name of a popular place that many people who come to Chiang Mai will go to visit once because there is beautiful scenery surrounded by mountains in 360 degrees with cool weather. There is a field of flowers that are beautiful and comfortable. Mon Jam is located on a mountain ridge, which is the one part of the Nong Hoi Royal Project, in Mae Rim District.
sources.shortName: 6 Best places to visit in Mae rim, Chiang Mai News & Activities - BOONSIRI HIGH SPEED CATAMARAN

sources.snippet: Mon Jam is a charming mountain retreat located north of Chiang Mai in the picturesque region of Mae Rim. Brought to life by the leafy hills of northern Thailand, this popular location offers a unique blend of tranquility, natural beauty, and cultural experiences. One of the highlights of Mon Jam is its breathtaking landscapes.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

places.name: Mon Jam

reviews.text: Yay! We saw the cherry blossoms üå∏and it was free as those cherry trees are just outside. It was very worth visiting! The views are stunning and the flowers are just so beautiful. For those people who love flowers and nature, it's a must visit. Those tickets to enter the farms are not that expensive compared to what you get to see and experience. The coffee could ease the cold. After all , it was a fantastic experience!

Wow this place is beautiful,  such amazing views over the valleys below. Very fascinating how the Thai people manage to grow crops on such steep lang, not to mention just how tasty that food is. Try the strawberries,  you won't regret it. The ride up from Chiang Mai is also a highlight,  as a motorcycle rider I relished the beautiful sweeping bends and perfect tarmac.

Went here during August which is off-season, not really any tourists around and most of the attractions are closed.

No strawberries too, which is sad.

Otherwise its awesome for the weather and the view! The flowers looked amazing, many colors. Overall a really nice place for the views!

places.address: Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Doi Suthep is a 5,499-foot mountain in Chiang Mai, Thailand, known for its picturesque trails through evergreen forests and a hilltop temple called Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. The temple, coated in gold and nearly 800 years old, offers stunning views of the city below. It's a popular tourist spot, so visiting in the morning is recommended to avoid crowds.

sources.snippet: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep: Perched on a mountaintop overlooking the city, Wat Phra That Doi Suthep is Chiang Mai‚Äôs most famous temple. Established in the 14th century, this sacred site is renowned for its golden chedi (stupa) and stunning panoramic views. To reach the temple, you can either climb the 306-step Naga staircase or take a cable car.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai: The Ultimate Travel Guide (2024)

sources.snippet: Another route, also popular with bike tours, is going South and trek the Doi Suthep mountain. You can find this peak right in the middle of Doi Suthep-Pui National Park. It is one of the most popular trekking destinations in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders

places.name: Doi Suthep

reviews.text: About a half hour enjoyable scooter ride to this must visit temple just outside of the city. Very well maintained and you get great views of the area.

Nice temple about 30 minutes away from Chiang Mai. We took a red car to get there. It was pretty busy but that didn't take away from the experience. We spent around 1 hour walking around the temple. After we got some food over the road.

A temple situated outside of Chiang Mai city is a sacred site nestled within a forest, attracting devotees for prayer. To reach the temple, visitors must ascend over 300 stairs or opt for the elevator by purchasing a 20 THB ticket. The entry fee for foreign visitors is 50 THB. From Chiang Mai, transportation options include Bolt, Grab bike, or cab. Alternatively, a shared ride can be availed from the songthaew stand near Chang Phuak Market for 80 THB.

places.address: Suthep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the lush landscapes of Thailand, Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden has been captivating visitors since 1992. The garden boasts a diverse collection of rare Thai plants, greenhouses, and beautifully landscaped grounds. One of its main attractions is the Glasshouse Complex, which showcases an array of aquatic plants, lotuses, water lilies, orchids, tropical rainforest plants, cacti and carnivorous plants.

sources.snippet: Queen Sirikit Botanical Garden is an exquisite garden with numerous indigenous and exotic plants. Set against a mountain backdrop, this botanical garden is a great place to relax and spend your day walking through the garden, picnicking, and strolling through the treetop canopy walkway. The gardens are extensive, and exploring them entirely on foot is not recommended.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

sources.snippet: Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden: opens everyday between 8.30AM to 5PM Beautiful botanic garden with a huge greenhouse, which has 11 flowers and plants such as rainforest flowers and various orchids and f...
sources.shortName: Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

sources.snippet: Queen Sirikit Botanical Garden, another new landmark of Mae Rim District. Suitable for leisure travel with family on a casual day. There are many types of plants, that provide of tree shade.
sources.shortName: 6 Best places to visit in Mae rim, Chiang Mai News & Activities - BOONSIRI HIGH SPEED CATAMARAN

sources.snippet: Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden covers a mountainous area of 560 acres. It is located around Km. 12 along the Mae Rim-Samoeng route.
sources.shortName: Nearby Attraction - Maesa Valley Garden Resort & Craft Village Chiangmai, Mae Rim, Thailand

places.name: Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden

reviews.text: Had a lovely half day exploring the gardens and facilities - had a nice lunch/coffee at the QSBG information Centre.  The grounds are well maintained and zero rubbish.  The hot houses are amazing and I saw plants I have never seen before.  Well worth the small fee at the main gate.

Absolutely stunning place! Striking Botanical Garden truly lives up to its name - every path and corner is filled with natural beauty. There's an impressive variety of plants from around the world, everything is well-maintained, and the atmosphere is peaceful and relaxing. Perfect for a walk, taking photos, or just clearing your mind. I really enjoyed my visit - highly recommended!
Entrance fee 150thb

Lovely botanical gardens, well priced for the experience. The canopy walk gives an amazing view of the jungle and the separate conservatories offer an excellent perspective on a wide range of plants such as waterlilies and succulents. We didn't get to the Science Museum sadly, but this is also included in the entrance fee. There are eateries there and I believe a shuttle bus to get to the different locations as the gardens are huge. I would recommend this for a day out!

places.address: 100 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà 9, Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the Doi Suithep-Pui National Park, Mae Sa Waterfall is a stunning 8-level cascade offering a refreshing plunge pool for swimming and well-maintained hiking trails. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely picnic amidst the natural beauty or explore nearby cultural attractions like the Chiang Mai City Arts and Cultural Center and the Hill-Tribe Research Institute Museum. The waterfall's 10 cascades each boast their own viewing deck, providing ample opportunities to relax and unwind.

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall is located in Doi Suthep-Pui National Park, and most people visit the waterfall to escape the midday heat and admire the waterfall. The Mae Sa Waterfall is made up of smaller waterfalls, around 9 or 10, that aren‚Äôt too far apart from one another. You can hike to each waterfall, take a few photos or spend the day picnicking next to one of the waterfalls.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

sources.snippet: A big waterfall is located at Doi Suthep-Pui National Park, Mae Rim District. Which has a total of 10 floors, each floor is far apart about 100-500 meters only. There are suitable for relaxing on your chilling day.
sources.shortName: 6 Best places to visit in Mae rim, Chiang Mai News & Activities - BOONSIRI HIGH SPEED CATAMARAN

sources.snippet: One of the best waterfalls in Chiang Mai is located in Mae Rim, called Mae Sa waterfall. It is the largest and most picturesque waterfall in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders

sources.snippet: 7 along the Mae Rim-Samoeng route is situated in a natural setting among towering trees and has a lovely breeze flowing throughout the year.
sources.shortName: Nearby Attraction - Maesa Valley Garden Resort & Craft Village Chiangmai, Mae Rim, Thailand
Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

places.name: Mae Sa Waterfall

reviews.text:
Entrance fee: 100 foreigner/20 local
Parking: 20 motorbike

Beautiful and amazing place to enjoy nature, there are 10 different areas to choose from. Water is refreshing not freezing cold, also pools aren't deep (you'll have to sit or get on your knees)

If you want to walk and get to know the whole place leave your vehicle in parking #1, if not go straight to parking #3 it's short walk to area #4

Starting from area #4 you'll find 3 beautiful small waterfalls in a row. It's worth it going all the way to area #10 (around 15 minute walk from area #4)

Toilets available in every parking lot #1 and #3. In parking lot #3 there are many places selling food.

Date 13/3/25

You need to buy ticket at the entrance. There was price for local and tourist but it was affordable. Signages and paths were well maintained. There were total of 10 waterfalls at the park and I had visited 9 out of 10. It was an easy trail which is suitable for family. You can spend few hours here hiking, picnic and playing water. But not during raining season. Just beware of slippery rocks. Good place to relax and chill.
Good for hiking and relaxing.weather is balance in the forest and food are normal price.you can play and feel under waterfall .it is have 10 step waterfalls and also wheelchair can go to step 5.

places.address: WV4X+H63, Soi Namtok Mae Sa 4, Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bai Orchid & Butterfly Farm is a charming greenhouse that houses a diverse array of butterflies, plants, and orchids. Visitors can also enjoy the beauty of rows of gorgeous orchids while sipping on refreshments at the on-site cafe. The farm is a popular stop for tourists exploring Chiang Mai, often combined with visits to Mae Sa waterfalls and hill-tribe villages.

sources.snippet: Usually, the first half day will be spent to explore Mae Sa waterfalls and visit the Orchid and Butterfly Farm. Mostly, the journey continues with a visit to a hill-tribe. When you get closer to Mae Tang area, you will probably explore the river on a white river rafting adventure.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders

sources.snippet: These farms also have special butterfly enclosures where tropical species can be seen in a natural environment. It is open daily from 08.00 a.m.
sources.shortName: Nearby Attraction - Maesa Valley Garden Resort & Craft Village Chiangmai, Mae Rim, Thailand

places.name: Bai Orchid & Butterfly Farm

reviews.text: This place offers a serene experience with its vibrant orchids and butterfly enclosures. Visitors can admire a variety of orchid species and observe butterflies in a lush garden setting. There is also a small caf√© and shop selling orchids and souvenirs. While most visitors appreciate the beauty and tranquility, some note that the butterfly section could be better maintained. It's a brief but enjoyable stop for nature enthusiasts exploring the Mae Rim area‚Äã
Beautiful, quiet and relaxing. Restaurant is brilliant too, we didn't do the buffet (but they were able to accommodate us with an a la carte - Khao Soi was excellent!!

Breath taken to see how many types of orchid they have on site. The place is very well designed and so very clean.  The butterfly house was so peaceful. Watching hundreds of they fly around is calming.  We did not have time to eat but it looked like the restaurant was very clean with many tables.  We spent a little more than an hour taking in all the beautiful sights.  It was a good decision to stop.

places.address: Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the lush landscapes of Chiang Mai, Thailand, Maerim Elephant Sanctuary offers a heartwarming experience for animal lovers and adventure seekers alike. This sanctuary is home to several rescued elephants from various backgrounds, including circuses and riding camps. Visitors can spend an entire day engaging with these gentle giants by feeding them, bathing them in mud pools, and learning about their daily lives through guided tours.

sources.snippet: Maerim Elephant Sanctuary has several rescued elephants from places like the circus and riding camps. At the sanctuary, you‚Äôll get to spend the day feeding and bathing the rescued elephants. The elephants at this sanctuary are well taken care of and loved, and during your guided tour of the sanctuary, you‚Äôll learn more about the elephants and their daily habits.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

places.name: Maerim Elephant Sanctuary

reviews.text:
I don't know how anyone could give this place below 5 stars for a review. It was truly one of the most amazing days that I've ever had. The staff and caretakers were all so lovely, the activities during the experience were fun and informative, but the best part was meeting the beautiful elephants.

It's really important to note that this elephant sanctuary is exactly that. A sanctuary. The elephants here are not for riding, everything is done on their terms and they are treasured and respected here, but you will have a lot of fun hugging, feeding them, and swimming with them. This was a wonderful experience and I'd definitely go again.

Thank you for the amazing opportunity to meet such lovely elephants with genuine friendly personality.  They look happy and after knowing about their difficult past, it's incredible how forgiving they are. I am so happy I had the pleasure of feeding, bathing, and playing with them. My son helped during last year 's rain season and invited me to come and see them. It was the best thing I experienced in Thailand.

Lovely sanctuary. With amazing creatures that are well taken care of and have a lovely and humane home here. Very knowledgeable guides. The photographers do an amazing job at capturing every moment. I wish I didn't bother taking pictures on my phone so I could just take in the moment. Must do if in Chiang Mai. Hotel pick up and drop off include in service.

places.address: 31, Ki Lek, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Mae Sa Elephant Camp, located in the Mae Sa Valley of northern Thailand, is a popular attraction where visitors can interact closely with elephants. It offers various experiences such as elephant shows, painting, and activities like bathing and riding. The camp is home to the largest assembly of domesticated elephants in the region and is dedicated to rescuing and protecting these magnificent creatures from abuse. Visitors can witness elephants painting, playing sports, dancing, pulling lumber, and even playing music.

sources.snippet: For this last place, it can be called pleasing elephant lovers with Maesa Elephant Camp. This is the largest elephant village in the North of Thailland. You can experience the cuteness of intelligent elephants.
sources.shortName: 6 Best places to visit in Mae rim, Chiang Mai News & Activities - BOONSIRI HIGH SPEED CATAMARAN

sources.snippet: The performance of the elephant show is 2 rounds a day at 9.40 AM and 1 PM (show for 1 hour). Elephant trekking is available from 7.30 AM to...
sources.shortName: Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

places.name: Mae Sa Elephant Camp

reviews.text: The 800 THB experience at the elephant sanctuary was fantastic! It included making food, feeding the elephants and taking photos. The elephants seemed well cared for and the staff was friendly. It's a great value for an ethical, hands-on experience with these gentle giants. Highly recommended! Follow @roxana.iamandi.üôèüèªüëçüèª

Mae Sa Elephant Camp is a very interesting and thoughtful place to visit. What's particularly heartening is that there are no elephant rides here - instead, visitors are encouraged to interact with the elephants in a more ethical and respectful way.

The entrance ticket includes a basket of bananas and mangoes for feeding the elephants, which is a lot of fun. Each elephant has its own preference - some go straight for the bananas, while others absolutely love mangoes. It's amusing to watch their personalities shine through.

The camp is set in a lush, green environment with a gentle stream flowing through, creating a peaceful and natural space for the elephants. While it's hard to fully know how the animals are cared for behind the scenes, we truly hope they are treated with the kindness they deserve. If you're looking for an ethical elephant experience in Thailand, this is a great place to consider.

We had gotten recommend this tour and glad we did. Was fun to interact with the elephants, feed them and the see just how capable they are. If I had not witnessed them pain I would not have believed it. The fished painting photo is below. They had an on site buffet that have a very good assortment of food and drinks.  The family really enjoyed our visit and made some good memories.

places.address: 101, Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50230, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the scenic Mae Rim district of Chiang Mai, Elephant POOPOOPAPER Park is a delightful eco-conscious destination that offers a unique twist on recycling. This charming park invites visitors to explore the fascinating process of transforming elephant dung into various paper products, including journals and stationery. Perfect for families, it features interactive exhibits where you can learn about sustainability while crafting your own POOPOOPAPER souvenirs.

sources.snippet: Elephant Poopoopaper is an eco-friendly museum to learn about paper productions from elephant poop fibres!. The tour includes walking through the site gardens and seeing all the different stages from poo collection, rinsing to final product assembly.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders

sources.snippet: Elephant POOPOOPAPER Park: opens everyday between 9.00AM to 17.30PM. Learn about elephants, make paper from elephant dung, learn about preserving nature to stay with us for a long time and have many c...
sources.shortName: Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

places.name: Elephant POOPOOPAPER Park Chiang Mai

reviews.text: What a wonderful venture.  We were treated to an interesting tour which was engaging for adults and children alike.  The experience is very hands on and everyone enjoyed making some paper as well as creating a craft with the provided materials (note there is a small fee for this).  The shop is also packed with lovely gifts and souvenirs made from the elephant poo products.  Highly recommend this as an educational and fun experience.

A very pleasant place to visit with children. You can learn how paper is made from fiber - in this case, fiber sourced from animal droppings. Everything is clean and properly washed, and it highlights an alternative, eco-friendly raw material. The guides are great at explaining the process, and at the end, there's a chance to take part in hands-on activities using the handmade paper. The kids absolutely loved that part!

A visit to the Elephant POOPOOPAPER Park in Chiang Mai is definitely worthwhile, especially for anyone who loves elephants. ÔºàThere's NO REAL üêò) The staff explain the entire papermaking process in great detail. It's fascinating to see how they turn elephant dung into paper!
The park also offers a hands-on activity where you can create your own craft, which is a big hit for families with kids. It's a fun and educational experience for all ages.
And be warned: the gift shop at the end is amazing! There are so many unique souvenirs that you'll definitely want to buy. üêòüêòüêò

places.address: 87 Moo. 10 T, Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand
